0.title: Horrific experience: Shabana Azmi on 21-yr-old niece left on bridge at night by Ola driver
0.article_body: Actress Shabana Azmi shared her 21-year-old niece's "horrific experience" where her Ola cab allegedly left her mid-ride on Mumbai's Dadar bridge in the night. "Driver realised...he'd reach home late due to traffic...so he made me get off on Dadar bridge," her niece said. "I had to walk down the bridge...It took me 2 hours to reach my destination," she added.

1.title: Romania to send arms, supplies worth €3 mn to Ukraine amid invasion
1.article_body: Romania will send equipment and supplies to Ukraine worth €3 million amid the Russian invasion, Romanian government has said. Provisions will include fuel, ammunition, bullet-proof vests, helmets, food and water. Additionally, ambulances will pick up pregnant women, the elderly and children waiting in queues trying to cross over from Ukraine into Romania at the northeastern Siret crossing point.

2.title: US waives in-person interview for many visa applicants including students till Dec 31
2.article_body: The US has waived in-person interview requirements for many visa applicants through December 31, an official said. The applicants eligible for the waiver are students (F, M, and academic J visas), workers (H-1, H-2, H-3, and individual L visas), Culture and extraordinary ability (O, P, and Q visas). Eligible applicants must have previously been issued any category of US visa.

3.title: Stakhovsky to take up arms to fight Russia, says 'I've experience with a gun'
3.article_body: Former Ukrainian tennis player Sergiy Stakhovsky has enlisted himself in his country's reserve army amid war with Russia. "I would fight, it’s the only reason I’m trying to get back. I don’t have military experience, but I do have experience with a gun privately," he said. Earlier, Klitschko brothers took up arms to defend Ukraine against Russia.

4.title: Australian cricket team lands in Pakistan for 1st tour in 24 years, pics surface
4.article_body: Members of the 18-member squad picked for Australian men's cricket team's first trip to Pakistan in 24 years landed in Islamabad during the early hours of Sunday morning. Australia last played in Pakistan in 1998, winning the three-match Test series 1-0 and winning the ODI series 3-0. The upcoming Test series will be Pat Cummins' first overseas series as captain.

5.title: Was informed just 45 mins before evacuation: B'luru student on arrival from Ukraine
5.article_body: Among the first batch of students evacuated from Ukraine, 12 of them arrived in Karnataka on Sunday. A Bengaluru-based student studying in Ukraine said, "On February 26, just 45 minutes before evacuation, we were informed to pack our luggage...The local police helped us to cross the border. We were then airlifted from Bucharest to Mumbai and to Bengaluru."

6.title: Ukraine govt shares pic of residential building shelled by Russia near Kyiv
6.article_body: Ukraine's Centre for Strategic Communications and Information Security took to Twitter to share a picture of a residential building shelled by Russian army. "Russia is committing war crimes. Today Russian army shelled a residential building in Bucha...15 km from Kyiv," it wrote. It also said that Russian tanks shot down a bus with civilians in Okhtyrka district of Sumy region.

7.title: Russia's actions bear signs of genocide, kids will be killed subtly: Ukrainian Prez
7.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday urged the world to scrap Russia’s voting power at the UN Security Council. He said, "They are going to bomb our Ukrainian cities, even more, they are going to kill our children even more subtly...Russia's criminal actions against Ukraine bear signs of genocide." Russian forces have entered into Ukraine's second-largest city, Kharkiv.

8.title: Mom told me it's not colour but heart that matters: Remo on being called 'kalu'
8.article_body: Filmmaker-choreographer Remo Dsouza took to Instagram to share a video that had Mohd Rafi's song 'Hum Kale Hai To Kya Hua Dil Wale Hai' playing in the background. In his post, he opened up about how he used to hate when people called him 'kaalia' or 'kalu'. "But...mom told me...it's not the colour it's the heart that matters," Remo added.

9.title: Not everything goes as per the plan: Rubina on suffering back injury
9.article_body: Actress Rubina Dilaik recently took to Instagram to inform her fans about her injury. In the post shared by Rubina, she is seen wearing pink coloured activewear with 5-6 bandages on her back. Alongside the post, Rubina wrote, "Not everything goes as per the plan." Soon after Rubina dropped the post, fans wished her for her speedy recovery.

10.title: Means a lot to start new life from grandparents' house: Sheetal on wedding
10.article_body: Actress Sheetal Thakur took to Instagram to share video of her Himachal wedding with actor Vikrant Massey and said that it means a lot to her to start her "new life" from her grandparents' house. "It's a village or whatever people call it. But this is me," she said in the video. Sheetal and Vikrant got married on February 18.

11.title: Had to wear 15kgs jewellery for song Chamma Chamma; got scratches: Urmila
11.article_body: During her appearance in 'Sa Re Ga Ma Pa', actress Urmila Matondkar revealed she got scratches on her body because she had to wear extremely heavy jewellery of about 15 kilograms for the 'banjaran' look in her song 'Chamma Chamma'. She added, "I got badly hurt by the earrings that I was wearing. I still remember it very clearly."

12.title: Radhe Shyam makers install free astrology booths in cinema halls across India
12.article_body: The makers of Prabhas-starrer 'Radhe Shyam' have installed astrology booths in a lot of cinema halls across India. Every booth is equipped with an astrologer who'll read the palms of people free of cost. Reportedly, the booths have already been attracting massive crowds across the theatres. In 'Radhe Shyam', Prabhas, too, will be seen essaying the role of a palmist.

13.title: Google blocks Russia's RT, other channels from making ad money
13.article_body: Alphabet's Google on Saturday blocked Russia's state-owned media outlet RT and other channels from receiving money for ads on their websites, apps and YouTube videos after Russia invaded Ukraine on Thursday. Russian media will not be able to buy ads through Google Tools or place ads on Google services. We'll take further steps if necessary, Google spokesman Michael Aciman said.

14.title: JD(U) candidate Rohit Wahengbam shot at by unidentified persons
14.article_body: Janata Dal (United) candidate from Manipur's Kshetrigao, Rohit Wahengbam, was shot at by unidentified persons ahead of the Manipur Assembly polls and is reported to now be in a critical but stable condition in the ICU. "We do not know who tried to kill him but they should be caught. He was targeted out of political rivalry," said Wahengbam's mother.

15.title: Ukraine to create 'IT army' to hit Russian websites
15.article_body: Ukraine is planning to launch an 'IT army' to strike Russia on the cyber front, said the country's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov. "We are creating an IT army. We need digital talents," tweeted Fedorov. He also shared a list of prominent Russian websites, saying, "There will be tasks for everyone. We continue to fight on the cyber front."

16.title: Words not enough to praise PM Modi’s role amid Ukraine crisis: Rajnath Singh
16.article_body: Campaigning in UP's Bairia, Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Sunday hailed Prime Minister Narendra Modi's role amid the Ukraine crisis. "Words are not enough to praise PM Modi for his role," said Singh. He also said, "Earlier, when India used to speak on global stages, the world didn't take it seriously. Now when India speaks, the world pays attention."

17.title: 90% in 15-18 age group received 1st vaccine dose in Delhi: Govt
17.article_body: Ninety percent of adolescents in the 15-18 age group have been administered the first dose of vaccine against COVID-19, according to official data. Until February 24, 54% of them had received the second dose of the vaccine, the data showed. The data was presented during a meeting of the Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) earlier this week.

18.title: Have used 27 players so far, there could be more: Rohit ahead of 3rd T20I
18.article_body: Hinting at possible changes for third and final T20I against Sri Lanka after Team India secured the three-match series 2-0, India captain Rohit Sharma said, "We have used 27 players so far, there could be more (laughs)." He added, "When you win the series, there are guys who haven't had the opportunities." Third T20I will be played today in Dharamshala.

19.title: Rohit has a lot of trust in me, he tells me to set my own field: Bumrah
19.article_body: Talking about his relationship with India captain Rohit Sharma, pacer Jasprit Bumrah said they've reached the stage where Rohit tells him to set his own field. "In the initial days [at MI] as well, Rohit had a lot of trust in me. He gave me the important overs and told me, 'Okay, [you] can do the job'," revealed Bumrah.

20.title: I think Pak crowd will support me, they'll also hope we lose: Khawaja
20.article_body: Australia batter Usman Khawaja said that he anticipates the crowd in Pakistan to support him in the upcoming Test series but added the crowd will also want Australia to lose. "We've always had great support from Pakistan. I'm not sure how many of them will be turning up...But from all over the sub-continent, I've always had great support," he added.

21.title: Harshal needs to fine-tune slower balls in Dharamshala in 3rd T20I: Zaheer
21.article_body: Ex-India pacer Zaheer Khan has said India pacer Harshal Patel needs to "fine-tune" his slower deliveries to Dharamshala's condition without altering his approach and execution ahead of third T20I against Sri Lanka. "Dharamshala is a high-altitude ground as well so the ball also travels differently," he added. Harshal posted 4-0-52-1 in second T20I against Sri Lanka in Dharamshala.

22.title: I feel incredibly safe, we've been well looked after by PCB: Cummins
22.article_body: After the Australian cricket team landed in Islamabad on Sunday, Test captain Pat Cummins said, "I feel incredibly safe...we've been really well looked after by the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB)." This is Australia's first tour of Pakistan since 1998. Cummins added, "There's been lots of security upon arrival." Australia will play three Tests, three ODIs and one T20I in Pakistan.

23.title: Defamation case against Union Minister for remarks on Disha Salian
23.article_body: A defamation case has been registered in Mumbai against Union Minister Narayan Rane and his MLA son Nitesh Rane for allegedly making defamatory remarks against Disha Salian, who was former manager of late actor Sushant Singh Rajput. At a press conference, they had alleged that there was foul play behind Salian's death. Police had said that she died by suicide.

24.title: MP's Ujjain to light up with 21 lakh diyas on Mahashivratri on March 1
24.article_body: Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain will reportedly be lit with 21 lakh diyas on Mahashivratri on March 1. Reports said city will be illuminated at 7 pm and the diyas will be lit for an hour. It will take 12,000 volunteers to light diyas. Ujjain District Collector said 15 lakh diyas were to be lit but were increased due to people's enthusiasm.
